intro: Cyrtomium hemionitis, commonly known as the golden fern, is a species of evergreen fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant features a compact, dense frond structure with a distinctive golden hue on its underside, which becomes more pronounced as it matures. Its rhizomes are thick and creeping, allowing it to form dense colonies in shaded, moist environments. Cyrtomium hemionitis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
